channel.title: College
channel.description:
So I'm currently in my junior year of hs, which, here in America, is the year of college preparation. The only issue is, I have no idea what I want to do.There are things I know I'm not interested, however I just don't enjoy the idea of selecting one field that I have to do.
In classes, I've always been more of a history/English person. While I have understandings of sciences and math, I don't majorly enjoy them. For example, when talking about things like quantum mechanics and theories of the universe, I like to theorize, not use math to examine things.
What I feel is that the job market is having a demand for more of the technology based careers. I do have some hope for the re-age of personal service and communications, however only in select fields. So what do you guys recommend? I want some sort of field where I don't have to be glued in one spot, but also has potential unlike some shitty liberal art.

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Yeah, that’s a lot farther than I am from my family. Only 2,000 miles, there. A lot of the people I know are online too, though. They tend to follow me around.

Read full topic

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:14, topic:474880”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=592864.msg4185521#msg4185521 date=1356102678]

Come make video games with me!

Sounds tempting. It was my original plan, until I realized that I lack creativity. (And taken into consideration that the job marked for game developers are pretty small in Norway)
[/quote]

So come to Washington, USA and attend DigiPen. Higher population of international students than any school I’ve seen. Plus, you don’t need to be a great designer to be a great programmer![/quote]
If I could get someone with me it could be something to consider, it isn’t as tempting to move 7000 km away from everyone I know.

Read full topic

item.description:
@rash wrote:

Have you ever considered studying education?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:11, topic:474880”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=592864.msg4185362#msg4185362 date=1356069409]
Come make video games with me!
[/quote]
Sounds tempting. It was my original plan, until I realized that I lack creativity. (And taken into consideration that the job marked for game developers are pretty small in Norway)[/quote]

So come to Washington, USA and attend DigiPen. Higher population of international students than any school I’ve seen. Plus, you don’t need to be a great designer to be a great programmer!

Read full topic

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

What ever you choose to study, there’s always more than 1 job that you can get out of it.

Not to mention, you can drop out if you dislike and do something else. You might fall be behind all your mates by a year but who cares, as long as you’re doing something you like or tolerate in the future.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Lol, you don’t really need a certain path until late sophomore / early junior year in college.

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Well, it’s always been my dream to have a job dealing with technology so I’m a comp. sci major and I’ve always been good with math so I’m a math minor. Before I was going to major in architecture but there’s no major universities in my area and I didn’t want to move too far from my parents.

Read full topic

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“nuts, post:5, topic:474880”]I’m in the same boat with you, Rey. I have not one clue what I want to do (I’m a junior as well), all I know is my career must consist of biology.

So, if it isn’t too much to ask, I’d like some advice one my future career as well. That is if it’s okay with you, Rey.[/quote]

Become a pharmacist. Studies would be, on the general aspect, biology and chemistry. You’d also be required to ethics classes, etc. Roughly 5-6 years of schooling. Pays 80-100 grand a year. Get cash to count pills. Win at life.

The issue I have is the stationary aspect. I’d prefer some sort of sales job with a flat $25,000 a year, with a $100,000 commission cap. I like the motivation and the strive to work. I just couldn’t do any “safe” 10 year contract, moderate benefits, $52,000 a year desk job. I’d blow my brains out.

Read full topic

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

Well rey all I have to say is just do what you enjoy doing as long as you make some sort of living to live off of(of course)

Read full topic

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @nuts nuts
item.description:
@nuts wrote:

I’m in the same boat with you, Rey. I have not one clue what I want to do (I’m a junior as well), all I know is my career must consist of biology.

So, if it isn’t too much to ask, I’d like some advice one my future career as well. That is if it’s okay with you, Rey.

Read full topic

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

stay away from the Liberal arts hippie.

Read full topic

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @DillanClymer DillanClymer
item.description:
@DillanClymer wrote:

same here i’m currently a senior and our home school didn’t really help us one bit, but we also got enrolled into a trade school witch is partners with our home school and they have been VERY helpful im in the emerging technologies class which programs and we’ve had college reps college fairs and tours of colleges through them also do research i suggest bigfuture.com or myfuture.com we came across this because our project is creating a college calculation website and just by doing that research it helps alot you wont really know everything until your actually in college i think personally just like high school experience it to know it

But just google some college information but cost is a main thing and your act score/sat score and gpa
and you can always switch colleges my plan is to attend Delta community college cost are lower and also i get finacial aid so it wont be that expensive after i spend 2 years there im going to get a major in computer science and minor in buisness.

So just look for colleges that are in your price range, community colleges cheaper than universities, make sure the school offers classes you like, theres tons more info but it’s just a google click away hopefully you can understand all of this kinda rambled on for a bit haha

Read full topic

item.title: College
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

You can always double major in college or major in one subject and minor in another. I had no idea about college at all until I went to a college fair. Surely your school offers some type of program to see what colleges offer or maybe a local college fair.

Read full topic
